headline: Lawmakers Vote to Prohibit Minors' Transgender Surgery
sentences: (Newser) – The Arizona Legislature passed bills Thursday to prohibit gender reassignment surgery for minors and transgender athletes from playing on girls sports teams, joining a growing list of Republican-controlled states attempting to restrict transgender rights as they gain more visibility in culture and society.

Since 2017, about 16 trans athletes have received waivers to play on teams that align with their gender identities out of about 170,000 high school athletes in the state, according to the Arizona Interscholastic Association.
Republicans have said blocking transgender athletes from girls sports teams would protect the integrity of women's sports, claiming that trans athletes would have an advantage.
Many point to the transgender collegiate swimmer Lia Thomas, who won an individual title at the NCAA Women’s Division I Swimming and Diving Championship last week.
Two GOP governors this week bucked conservatives in their party and vetoed bills in Indiana and Utah requiring trans girls to play on boys sports teams.
But the issue has come front and center in Republican-led statehouses since Idaho lawmakers passed the nation's first sports participation law in 2020.
"We're talking about legislating bullying against children who are already struggling just to get by," said Democratic Rep. Kelli Butler.
Opponents said the legislation dehumanizes trans youth to address an issue that hasn't been a problem.
"In my opinion, it's unfair to allow biological males to compete with biological girls sports."
Until two years ago, no state had passed a law regulating gender-designated youth sports.
"This bill to me is all about biology," said Republican Rep. Shawnna Bolick.
Doug Ducey has not said whether he will sign either bill, the AP reports.
That law is now blocked in court, along with another in West Virginia.
But there are few trans athletes in Arizona schools.
